org.activebpel.rt.bpel.impl
Interface IAeBusinessProcessInternal

All Superinterfaces:
IAeActivity, IAeBpelObject, IAeBusinessProcess, IAeLocatableObject
All Known Implementing Classes:
AeBusinessProcess
public interface IAeBusinessProcessInternal
extends IAeBusinessProcess, IAeActivity

Internal extensions to business process allows classes within the implemenation to use the process while still hiding the implementor.

Method Detail

isExiting

public boolean isExiting()
Returns true if the process is exiting. If a process is exiting then there is no fault handling, compensation, or termination handling. All activities must terminate immediately.

addVariableMapping

public void addVariableMapping(IAeVariable aVar)

getNextVersionNumber

public int getNextVersionNumber()
The process maintains unique values for each version of a variable and partner link. Each time a variable's (or partner link's) data changes it gets a new id for the storage layer.

setNextVersionNumber

public void setNextVersionNumber(int aId)
Sets the next id to use when getNextVariableVersionNumber() is called.

Parameters:

addExclusiveLock

public boolean addExclusiveLock(java.util.Set aSetOfVariablePaths,
                                java.lang.String aOwnerXPath)
Called by serializable scopes prior to execution to ensure that they have all of the necessary locks on the variables being used by their enclosed activities. If the locks are immediately obtained then the activity proceeds with its normal execution path. If not, then execution is halted for the activity until the lock can be acquired. At that time, the activity will resume normal execution and release any of its locks after it is complete.

Parameters:
aSetOfVariablePaths -
aOwnerXPath -

addSharedLock

public boolean addSharedLock(java.util.Set aSetOfVariablePaths,
                             java.lang.String aOwnerXPath)
Called by activities prior to execution to ensure that they have all of the necessary locks on the variables being used by their enclosed activities. If the locks are immediately obtained then the activity proceeds with its normal execution path. If not, then execution is halted for the activity until the lock can be acquired. At that time, the activity will resume normal execution and release any of its locks after it is complete.

Parameters:
aSetOfVariablePaths -
aOwnerXPath -

linkStatusChanged

public void linkStatusChanged(IAeLink aLink)
This method allows a callback for links, which allows for either deadpath elimination or allowing a queued activity to execute.

Parameters:
aLink - The link that has changed its status.

objectCompleted

public void objectCompleted(IAeBpelObject aObject)
                     throws AeBusinessProcessException
This method is a callback for objects to notify the process that it is done. An object's completion is a two step process. The first step is reaching the completion state which is done by calling this method. The second step is the evaluation of an object's links. The parent should be notified of the child's completion after the links have been evaluated in order to catch any faults during link evaluation.

Parameters:
aObject - The object which has completed.
Throws:
AeBusinessProcessException

objectCompletedWithFault

public void objectCompletedWithFault(IAeBpelObject aObject,
                                     IAeFault aFaultObject)
                              throws AeBusinessProcessException
This method is a callback for objects to notify the process that it is done, but that an error has occured as indicated by the passed fault object. The process will then notify the parent and fire appropriate events.

Parameters:
aObject - The object which has completed.
aFaultObject - The fault which caused the object to complete.
Throws:
AeBusinessProcessException

objectStateChanged

public void objectStateChanged(IAeBpelObject aObject,
                               AeBpelState aOldState,
                               IAeStateChangeDetail aDetailsObject)
                        throws AeBusinessProcessException
This method is a callback for objects to notify the process that they're state has changed.

Parameters:
aObject -
aOldState -
aDetailsObject - - object used to report any additional information along with the state change, most notably the fault that caused the object to become faulted.
Throws:
AeBusinessProcessException

queueAlarm

public void queueAlarm(IAeAlarmReceiver aAlarm,
                       java.util.Date aDeadline)
                throws AeBusinessProcessException
Queue an alarm to callback when the passed dealine has been reached.

Parameters:
aAlarm - The alarm to callback when the dealine is reached.
aDeadline - The deadline for the alarm.

queueInvoke

public void queueInvoke(IAeInvokeActivity aInvoke,
                        IAeMessageData aInputMessage,
                        IAePartnerLink aPartnerLink,
                        AePartnerLinkOpImplKey aPartnerLinkOpImplKey)
                 throws AeBusinessProcessException
Will queue an invoke to take place. A framework in the engine will typically perform the actual invoke and then call back the invoke response receiver.

Parameters:
aInvoke - The object to receive the callback when the invoke response is ready.
aInputMessage - The input message for the invoke, null if none.
aPartnerLink - The partner link
aPartnerLinkOpImplKey - The partner link key
Throws:
AeBusinessProcessException - Thrown if error occurs setting the receiver.

                                 int aGroupId)
                          throws AeBusinessProcessException
Sets a message receiver for the given correlated business operation from the specified partner link.

Parameters:
aMessageReceiver - The receiver to call back when the message is received.
aGroupId -
Throws:
AeBusinessProcessException - Thrown if error occurs setting the receiver.

public void queueReply(IAeMessageData aInputMessage,
                       javax.xml.namespace.QName aFaultName,
                       AePartnerLinkOpImplKey aPartnerLinkOpImplKey,
                       java.lang.String aMessageExchange)
                throws AeBusinessProcessException
Queues the reply.

Parameters:
aInputMessage - can be null
aFaultName - can be null
aPartnerLinkOpImplKey -
aMessageExchange - can be null
Throws:
AeBusinessProcessException

removeReceiverKeyForConflictingReceives

public void removeReceiverKeyForConflictingReceives(IAeMessageReceiverActivity aMessageReceiver)
Removes the receiver from the process's collection of receive activities used to track bpws:conflictingReceives. This gets called by the receive or onMessage when it receives its data. In the case of an onEvent within a scope, the onMessage will not remove itself until it has been dequeued since events remain queued in BPEL 2.0.

Parameters:
aMessageReceiver -

                        java.lang.String aMessageExchange)
                 throws AeBusinessProcessException
Removes the waiting reply object.

aMessageExchange -
Throws:
AeBusinessProcessException
